articles.headline: Nine arrests made in Dorset over organised crime ring

story_classification.reasoning: Hard news crime reporting. Standard police statement reporting about arrests and seizures.

beat_context.reasoning: Crime/policing beat. Not inherently gendered - organized crime involves all genders.

quoted_sources.name: Detective Superintendent Emma Sweetzer
quoted_sources.role_reasoning: Dorset Police Detective Superintendent providing official police statement about enforcement action. External authority representing law enforcement, not part of the crime story. Test: Could this source be replaced by another expert? YES - any senior police official could provide similar policy statement.

articles.headline: Christchurch Chef Reveals Excitement Over New Locally-Produced Menus

story_classification.reasoning: Business/food news about restaurant launching local produce initiative. Standard reporting with business representatives quoted.

beat_context.reasoning: Food/restaurant beat. Not inherently gendered - chefs and restaurant managers of all genders.

quoted_sources.name: Quentin Royles
quoted_sources.role_reasoning: Chef at Eighteen Restaurant leading the local produce initiative. He IS the story - the restaurant implementing the change. Test: Could this source be replaced by another expert? NO - he's the chef at the specific restaurant being profiled.

quoted_sources.name: Simon Bennett
quoted_sources.role_reasoning: Restaurant Manager at Eighteen Restaurant involved in the initiative. He IS part of the business being profiled. Test: Could this source be replaced by another expert? NO - he manages the specific restaurant implementing the change.
